paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant Val50Met (V50M) in the context of ATTRv amyloidosis, providing details on penetrance, patient demographics, and functional data.

patients.demographics: 10 men, aged 37.2 ± 5.2 years; and 7 women, aged 43.5 ± 10.2 years

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Urine samples were obtained from 17 patients with ATTRv V50M amyloidosis.
Urine samples were obtained from 17 patients with ATTRv V50M amyloidosis.
Urine samples were obtained from 17 patients with ATTRv V50M amyloidosis.
Urine samples were obtained from 17 patients with ATTRv V50M amyloidosis.

functional_data.summary: Urinary TTR concentrations were significantly higher in patients with ATTRv V50M compared to healthy volunteers.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families as it is a known pathogenic variant.
variants.additional_notes: The study included both symptomatic patients and asymptomatic carriers.
key_quotes: Negligible TTR concentrations were seen in the urine of the asymptomatic carriers of ATTRv amyloidosis.
The urinary TTR concentrations did not correlate with the serum TTR concentrations.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
